title: noormcs5
author: noormcs5
content: For the last 24 hours I am facing and issue with bitget account that I am unable to receive an SMS on my mobile. I am trying to do my p2p transaction and before that they are asking to make a fund password. For that purpose received on the email but I am unable to receive the code on the my mobile device.If anyone else facing the same issue at bitget? Also I heard some rumours that bitget exchange is not trustable and they might scam in near future. Are those statements on the tutor true ?I am worried about my account and also we can't afford another exchange scam after ftx exchange.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: If you do not want to go for fund password, is the exchange not supporting 2FA instead? I do not even recommend sim authentication. Fund password is better, but 2FA code on another device is the best to me.Maybe the exchange is a scam? See the Trustpilot reviews: https://www.trustpilot.com/review/bitget.comThe review on Trustpilot is poor. I also checked Quora, people are adviced not to use the exchange. I was surprised that the exchange is ranked 15th.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: I haven't used the exchange before, so I am not sure if it's a general issue. It could be an issue with your network provider. Regardless, you should never rely on SMS for verification, It's better you try two factor authenticators. Some exchange apps at least access, even fingerprint verification.Try contacting their support. Maybe they could helpBitget is a low tier exchange like MEXC. They list all sorts of shitcoins, so you should be very careful with such exchanges.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: How did you know that Bitget will scam in the near future? Actually, it's a scam since before there are lots of reports outside of this forum.It is likely the same as yobit with lots of shitcoins and most of the shitcoins can't able to withdraw.Next time if you already do research and some say its a scam don't use their service unless your coins are only listed on their exchange?Would you mind to try if you can able to add 2FA for the authenticator app? So that you have option instead of receiving 2FA code in mobile generate it with an authenticator app. Sms 2FA sometimes delays even on other exchanges due to DDOS attacks so switching to the authenticator app is the best option.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: It's the most annoying thing with SMS 2FA. A lot of fiat services I've used heavily relies on SMS 2FA and mishaps like this are inevitable as we have to rely on third party services to get our codes which means there must be no problem with your provider and theirs for it to work. You can try to get in touch with your provider and bitget to check with them but if you can switch to TOTP, that would be better! as it provides better security and eliminates mishaps like this.As for them scamming, imo it's too early to tell... but they're certainly aren't with the reputable bunch and I've always suspected them to be faking a huge chunk of their volume. At the very least, I wouldn't place a large money with them.

comments.author: rat03gopoh
comments.body: Just wanted to share a story with the SMS verification problem I had a few months ago (not exchange) that even support couldn't help because the problem was actually on my side. Make sure that you're not blacklisting sms from bitget, maybe you forget you did it.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: There's isn't much you can do at this point. Just contact support and try to log in regularly. I've seen a tweet a couple of days ago of someone claiming to have lost +200,000 $ (stolen)[2] and if you check the comments, you can see that more people are reporting similar issues. You should definitely consider switching to another exchange once you get back access to your account.[1] https://twitter.com/EvanLuthra/status/1641727962566508545

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Quote from: rat03gopoh on April 02, 2023, 01:48:33 PMJust wanted to share a story with the SMS verification problem I had a few months ago (not exchange) that even support couldn't help because the problem was actually on my side. Make sure that you're not blacklisting sms from bitget, maybe you forget you did it.I had similar problems with SMS verifications, and the problem was on my end. It turned out that I had blocked the prefix of a foreign country because of SMS spam coming from that country, but a legitimate service for SMS messages is also located in that country, so I blocked both good and bad messages. It sounds strange, but such things happen. Personally, I do not prefer this method of verification, but in some cases it is the only choice and cannot be avoided.

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: I'm not going to comment on whether bit get is a legit service or not a I'm not so familiar with it and never used it before (I'll l√®ve this to other members).But what I wanted to say is that not receiving the verification SMS has nothing to do with the legitimacy of the service. I've faced the same issue with other highly reputable exchanges.It's usually due to a problem with their SMS service provider or your phone carrier. The problem usually get solved by trying to resend the verification code multiple times or retrying after a while. If the problem persists, then your only option is to contact their customer support.

comments.body: Quote from: noormcs5 on April 01, 2023, 11:12:00 PMFor the last 24 hours I am facing and issue with bitget account that I am unable to receive an SMS on my mobile. I am trying to do my p2p transaction and before that they are asking to make a fund password. For that purpose received on the email but I am unable to receive the code on the my mobile device.If anyone else facing the same issue at bitget? Also I heard some rumours that bitget exchange is not trustable and they might scam in near future. Are those statements on the tutor true ?I am worried about my account and also we can't afford another exchange scam after ftx exchange.FUND PASSWORD is another layer of security for you. They will prompt you to use a password different from the exchange login password so that even if someone gets access to your account, transferring your funds will be deterred without the funds password.Concerning SMS Code. It's simply to verify your mobile Phone number because you want to carry out P2P Peer to peer trading so that when making transaction with a peer, you can be called or you can call to confirm or complete transaction in case of delay. If you fail to recieve the code, check if you had activated DND do not disturb.. so you deactivate in other to recieve codes or check your network provider.I use Bitget and I use their p2p alot so I know this. I haven't had any issue with them. Meanwhile, the best place for initial support inquiries should be customer support or the exchange community. That way you'll get direct useful response. I hope this helps.
